text.p: - Russian big politics cannot function without scandals, the paper says in a comment on the appointment of businessman Boris Berezovsky to the Security Council.

- Tatarstan's president, Mintimer Shaimiyev, managed to convince the government Emergency Commission to exclude the Kamaz truck factory from the bankruptcy list. Shaimiyev said he feared serious social problems may arise if the factory stops work.
- Finance Minister Alexander Livshits, in a letter to Prime minister Viktor Chernomyrdin dated October 17, has in effect confirmed that Russia is on the edge of the budget crisis.
- The appointment of businessman Boris Berezovsky has just made his long time alliance with the state authorities official.
- On the eve of President Yeltsin's heart operation, the political situation in Russia has become tense again.
- A shadow capitalist government is taking over official positions in Russia. Top businessmen want to control politics openly, says the pro-communist paper.

- After presidential elections all political power in the country has been accumulated in hands of the president's chief-of-staff Anatoly Chubais, says Yeltsin's former press-secretary, Pavel Voshchanov.
